Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: First I need to understand the process tree operators -> ( A B ) tells that the process tree A should be executed before the process tree B X ( A B ) tells that there is an exclusive choice between executing the process tree A or the process tree B + ( A B ) tells that A and B are executed in true concurrency * ( A B ) is a loop So the process tree A is executed then either you exit the loop or you execute B and then A again the leafs of a process tree are either activities denoted by X where X is the name of the activity or silent steps indicated by tau

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now breaking down the complex process description into a hierarchical structure Start 1 The patient begins their journey by Arriving (A) at the hospital reception Upon arrival the patient must complete a Registration (RG) process to handle personal data insurance details and assign a patient ID Following registration the patient undergoes an initial Intake Assessment (IA) to gather preliminary health information 2 After the intake assessment the patient must be evaluated by the triage team This involves two mandatory activities in sequence - Triage Interview (TI) to understand symptoms and severity - Triage Classification (TC) to assign the patient a priority level So extending the sequence A -> RG -> IA -> TI -> TC

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3 Based on the triage classification there is an exclusive decision on the type of initial diagnostic tests - If the patient is suspected of a cardiovascular issue they perform a Comprehensive ECG (CE) - Otherwise if suspicion is more general or non-cardiac they perform a Full Blood Panel (FBP) Only one of these tests (CE or FBP) will be performed as the initial diagnostic procedure So after TC an XOR operator X (CE FBP) In process tree terms it is X ( CE FBP )

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 4 Once the initial diagnostic test is done the results must be evaluated If the results are abnormal a loop commences - The patient must be reviewed by a Specialist Consultation (SC) which could be a cardiologist hematologist or another specialist depending on the findings - After consultation an exclusive treatment choice is made - Administer a Targeted Medication (TM) or - Provide a Specialized Physical Therapy (SPT) session Following the treatment the patient must undergo a Re-Diagnostic Test (RDT) step The RDT itself is an exclusive choice similar to the initial test - Either a Follow-up ECG (FCE) if cardiac issues persist or - A Follow-up Blood Analysis (FBA) if the issue is non-cardiac This loop repeats after the re-diagnostic test if the results are still abnormal the patient returns to the Specialist Consultation and subsequent exclusive treatments This can happen multiple times until the results are deemed normal Once normal results are obtained the loop ends In the * operator it is execute A then either exit or execute B and then A again Mapping to the description - A in the loop could be the body that is always executed which includes SC then X(TM SPT) then RDT RDT is itself an XOR I can model the loop as * ( body tau ) where tau is a silent step representing the choice to repeat or not

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: But in the initial part if the initial diagnostic is normal we should directly go to the advanced part without entering the loop The description says after normal results are finally achieved the patient must proceed... implying that the normal results could be from the initial diagnostic or from the loop To model this in a process tree without conditions I need to have an exclusive choice after the initial diagnostic X ( abnormal_loop normal_tau ) where the normal branch is a silent step tau and the abnormal branch is the loop Then after this XOR the flow continues to the advanced imaging part

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 5 After normal results are finally achieved the patient must proceed with a set of advanced diagnostic imaging and lifestyle support activities These are done in true concurrency - Advanced Imaging (AI) - Nutritional Counseling (NC) Both activities should be completed but their order and concurrency are not fixed they can be done in parallel So + (AI NC) 6 Once the advanced imaging and nutritional counseling are finished the patient goes through a final sequence of administrative and informational steps - Follow-up Appointment Scheduling (FAS) - Detailed Discharge Instructions (DDI) So -> (FAS DDI) 7 Before the patient can leave a concurrency block handles the final administrative and financial clearances In parallel - Billing (BL) - Insurance Claims Processing (ICP) - Medical Records Finalization (MRF) These three activities occur in true concurrency After all these parallel activities are completed the patients process ends So + (BL ICP MRF)

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now back to the overall structure The entire process is mostly sequential with some parallel and choice operators inside So I can have a root with operator SEQUENCE and children being the subtrees for each major step 1 A 2 RG 3 IA 4 TI 5 TC 6 initial_diagnostic X(CE FBP) 7 result_decision X(abnormal_loop tau) 8 concurrent_advanced + (AI NC) 9 final_sequence -> (FAS DDI) 10 final_concurrent + (BL ICP MRF) All these in sequence under root For the loop abnormal_loop is * (loop_body tau) where loop_body is -> (SC X(TM SPT) X(FCE FBA))
